intro: Limnanthemum forsteri, commonly known as the yellow water lily, is a aquatic plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers that bloom above the water surface, while its leaves are broad and floating. The plant has a short, stout stem that supports its foliage and floral structures. Its roots are anchored in the mud at the bottom of still or slow-moving water bodies. Limnanthemum forsteri plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
